1: Praise the Lord. Sing to the Lord a new song. Praise him in the assembly of the godly.[b]
2: Let Israel rejoice in their Creator. Let the people[c] of Zion delight in their King.[d]
3: Let them praise his name with dancing. Let them sing praises to him to the accompaniment of the tambourine and harp.
4: For the Lord takes delight in his people; he exalts the oppressed by delivering them.[e]
5: Let the godly rejoice because of their vindication.[f] Let them shout for joy upon their beds.[g]
6: May the praises of God be in their mouths and a two-edged sword in their hands,
7: in order to take[h] revenge on the nations, and punish foreigners.
8: The godly bind[i] their enemies' kings in chains, and their nobles in iron shackles,
9: and execute the judgment to which their enemies[j] have been sentenced.[k] All his loyal followers will be vindicated.[l] Praise the Lord.
